title: Easily Make Amazon Ads for Your Self-Published Book - Publisher Rocket Tutorial

tactics.name: Publisher Rocket Keyword Generation
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to automate keyword research for Amazon ads by leveraging ASIN, existing keywords, and comparable titles.
steps: Filter similar books and add comparable titles
Select keyword targets (book, category, bestseller, author)
caveats: Requires manual filtering of irrelevant results
source_quotes: when you set up Amazon ads you need a lot more keywords than these seven keywords that you are allowed to use when you're setting up your book on KDP

tactics.name: manual_keyword_targeting
tactics.description: Create multiple keyword lists for specific niches like mental health or romance, then export and use them for manual Amazon ad targeting.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to gather keywords
Export keyword lists for different categories
Set custom bids (e.g., 33 cents) in Amazon ad campaigns
Add negative keywords to exclude irrelevant searches
caveats: Requires ongoing research as Amazon ad algorithms evolve
source_quotes: I want to make an ad target that is specific to more mental health
I personally always set my bid to 33

tactics.name: Publisher Rocket for Ads
tactics.description: Using Publisher Rocket to set up books on KDP and create keyword lists for Amazon ads
steps: Create keyword list for Amazon ads
source_quotes: I truly love using publisher rocket as a tool for setting my book up on KDP

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize books with higher review counts
source_quotes: the book that has like the most reviews so it'll be the one that will perform the best

heuristics.name: review_based_boosting
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting ad visibility
source_quotes: I have to re-evaluate the categories that my book is in

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Boost
source_quotes: The way Amazon ADS works is always changing

claims.statement: Amazon ad keywords require significantly more terms than KDP keywords
source_quotes: the keywords that you have when you set up your book on KDP is different from the keywords that you would use to set up an Amazon ad

claims.statement: Amazon ad strategies require continuous research due to changing platform mechanics
source_quotes: The way Amazon ADS works is always changing

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket is recommended for Amazon ad keyword research
source_quotes: I truly love using publisher rocket as a tool for creating a list of keywords for Amazon ads

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with unique constraints for niche markets
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (target audience), problem (ADHD), and constraint (Christian values) for precise keyword matching
source_quotes: mosquito land is one of the comp titles for meet me at the summit
